Life Skill Options:
Writing a thank
you note or drawing a gratitude card
How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Show Viraj your own thank-you note.
2. Together choose one person to thank this week.
3. Let him design the card and write the message.
4. Deliver personally or send photo.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: 3-min gratitude sharing.
After school: Game + “one good thing about today.”
Evening: Story about kindness.
Bonding Activity Options: Make a family gratitude jar together.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Name 5 colors you can see around
Walk heel-to-toe along a straight line
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Pick 3 tiny litter bits (with care)
Kicking practice to a goal line (10 kicks)
Time check: leave on schedule when called
Make a circle with chalk and do 5 jumps inside
Stone stack: build a 3‑stone tower
Stair count: up/down 10 steps safely, counting aloud
Hydration check: 5 sips of water mid-play
Balance walk on a painted line/curb (hand-in-hand if needed)
Slalom run around 5 cones/stones
Letter hunt: find shapes that look like A, O, T
Throw-and-catch 10 times (soft ball)
Trivia Bank (15+):
1. What do we use to brush our teeth? (Toothbrush)
2. What does a clock tell us? (Time)
3. Which shape has no corners? (Circle)
4. Which shape has three sides? (Triangle)
5. What do we wear on our head for safety while biking? (Helmet)
6. Which sense organ helps us see? (Eyes)
7. How many letters are there in the English alphabet? (Twenty-six)
8. What is the name of our country? (India)
9. How many wheels does a bicycle have? (Two)
10. What keeps our feet warm in winter? (Socks)
11. What keeps you dry in the rain? (Umbrella)
12. Which bird cannot fly but can run fast? (Ostrich)
13. What grows from a seed? (A plant)
14. Which animal says 'quack'? (Duck)
15. What do we wear on our feet? (Shoes)

Life Skill Options: Introducing yourself confidently to someone new
How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Role-play introductions at home.
2. Practice at park or shopkeeper.
3. Praise effort, not just outcome.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I am brave, I am strong.”
After school: Game + share “one brave thing.”
Evening: Story of a hero.
Bonding Activity Options: Go on a small adventure together (new park, cycling route).
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Nature sketch: 3‑minute quick drawing on a pad
Kicking practice to a goal line (10 kicks)
Practice patient queuing for a slide
Ask to join a group game politely
Stair count: up/down 10 steps safely, counting aloud
Sprint to a marker and back (3 rounds)
Leaf/rock collection: find 3 different textures
Say hello to one child and ask to join a turn
Walk heel-to-toe along a straight line
Return a found object to the guard/attendant
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Thank the gardener/guard on exit
Time check: leave on schedule when called
Hopscotch: 1–5 hops each
Trivia Bank (15+):
1. Which planet do we live on? (Earth)
2. Which planet is known as the Red Planet? (Mars)
3. Which shape has three sides? (Triangle)
4. What is the color of an orange? (Orange)
5. Which animal purrs? (Cat)
6. What do you call the home of a bird? (Nest)
7. Where does the sun rise? (In the east)
8. What fruit is sour and green? (Lime)
9. Which fruit has many tiny seeds on the outside? (Strawberry)
10. Which fruit keeps the doctor away? (Apple)
11. How many continents are there? (Seven)
12. What do we use to brush our teeth? (Toothbrush)
13. What do you call the person who teaches you? (Teacher)
14. Which animal has a long trunk? (Elephant)
15. Which star do we see in the daytime? (The Sun)

How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Demonstrate organising your own items.
2. Give Viraj a small area to keep neat.
3. Review together each evening.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “Today I will take care of…”
After school: Game + share responsibility done.
Evening: Story of responsibility.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Keep track of your water bottle
Jump over 5 small lines/tiles safely
Breathing with trees: inhale under shade, exhale long
Hydration check: 5 sips of water mid-play
Slalom run around 5 cones/stones
Balance a small leaf on your head for 10 steps
Balance walk on a painted line/curb (hand-in-hand if needed)
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Shadow tag (no pushing) for 3 minutes
Practice patient queuing for a slide
Thank the gardener/guard on exit
Time check: leave on schedule when called
Stone stack: build a 3‑stone tower
Roll a ball to each other 15 times
Trivia Bank (15+):
1. What keeps you dry in the rain? (Umbrella)
2. What is the color of an orange? (Orange)
3. What shape is a coin? (Circle)
4. What do bees live in? (A hive)
5. What fruit is sour and green? (Lime)
6. What is the color of the sky on a clear day? (Blue)
7. What do you call a baby cow? (Calf)
8. What do we call a baby dog? (Puppy)
9. Which shape has three sides? (Triangle)
10. What is the color of leaves in most plants? (Green)
11. How many wheels does a bicycle have? (Two)
12. Which fruit keeps the doctor away? (Apple)
13. What is H2O commonly called? (Water)
14. What does a traffic light's green mean? (Go)
15. Which festival celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna? (Janmashtami)

Life Skill Options: Speaking the truth even in small matters
How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Share a story of when telling truth was hard for you.
2. Praise him when he tells truth, even if inconvenient.
3. Play ‘truth-telling’ game at home.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I speak the truth.”
After school: Game + share one honest moment.
Evening: Story about honesty.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Breathing with trees: inhale under shade, exhale long
Walk heel-to-toe along a straight line
Kicking practice to a goal line (10 kicks)
Jump over 5 small lines/tiles safely
Count 10 trees or benches together
Tree pose (yoga) for 10 slow breaths
Balance a small leaf on your head for 10 steps
Shadow tag (no pushing) for 3 minutes
Slalom run around 5 cones/stones
Stair count: up/down 10 steps safely, counting aloud
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Offer a toy for sharing (1 minute)
Describe exactly what you see in the park (no exaggeration)
Cloud shapes: spot and describe 3 shapes
Trivia Bank (15+):
1. Which fruit keeps the doctor away? (Apple)
2. What keeps you dry in the rain? (Umbrella)
3. What shape is a pizza slice? (Triangle)
4. How many letters are there in the English alphabet? (Twenty-six)
5. Which shape has four equal sides? (Square)
6. How many wheels does a bicycle have? (Two)
7. Which festival celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna? (Janmashtami)
8. What grows from a seed? (A plant)
9. What do you call a young tree? (Sapling)
10. What do you call a baby horse? (Foal)
11. What is the color of an orange? (Orange)
12. What do you wear to see clearly if your vision is weak? (Glasses)
13. Which season is the coldest? (Winter)
14. Which animal is the largest mammal? (Blue whale)
15. What do cows give us to drink? (Milk)

How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Choose a simple help task daily.
2. Do it together once, then let him do it alone.
3. Acknowledge every act of kindness.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I will look for ways to help.”
After school: Game + share kindness done.
Evening: Story of kindness.
Bonding Activity Options: Make and deliver a small snack for neighbour or friend.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Balance a small leaf on your head for 10 steps
Roll a ball to each other 15 times
Follow-the-leader movement patterns (walk, tiptoe, stomp)
Throw-and-catch 10 times (soft ball)
Practice patient queuing for a slide
Offer a toy for sharing (1 minute)
Name 5 colors you can see around
Help a younger child climb safely
Thank the gardener/guard on exit
Kicking practice to a goal line (10 kicks)
Balance beam using a low bench/line (with support)
Leaf/rock collection: find 3 different textures
Return a found object to the guard/attendant
Trivia Bank (15+):
1. What keeps you dry in the rain? (Umbrella)
2. What do we use to cut paper safely? (Scissors)
3. Which shape has three sides? (Triangle)
4. What is H2O commonly called? (Water)
5. How many sides does a rectangle have? (Four)
6. What do you call baby cats? (Kittens)
7. What do we wear on our feet? (Shoes)
8. Which gas do plants take in? (Carbon dioxide)
9. What do bees collect from flowers? (Nectar)
10. What do you wear to see clearly if your vision is weak? (Glasses)
11. What do we use to brush our teeth? (Toothbrush)
12. Which sense organ helps us see? (Eyes)
13. What do we call the place we study? (School)
14. What do you call a young tree? (Sapling)
15. Which shape has four equal sides? (Square)

How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Play games that require turns.
2. Use a timer for small waits.
3. Praise when he waits calmly.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I can wait calmly.”
After school: Game that needs turn-taking.
Evening: Story about patience.
Bonding Activity Options: Plant a small seed and care for it together.

Time check: leave on schedule when called
Breathing with trees: inhale under shade, exhale long
Slalom run around 5 cones/stones
Follow-the-leader movement patterns (walk, tiptoe, stomp)
Walk heel-to-toe along a straight line
Throw-and-catch 10 times (soft ball)
Nature sketch: 3‑minute quick drawing on a pad
Leaf/rock collection: find 3 different textures
Letter hunt: find shapes that look like A, O, T
Cloud shapes: spot and describe 3 shapes
Shadow tag (no pushing) for 3 minutes
Jump over 5 small lines/tiles safely
Offer a toy for sharing (1 minute)
Bird watch: name color, size, sound of one bird
Trivia Bank (15+):
1. How many fingers do we have on one hand? (Five)
2. How many letters are there in the English alphabet? (Twenty-six)
3. What do fishes use to breathe? (Gills)
4. What do we use to brush our teeth? (Toothbrush)
5. What is the color of coal? (Black)
6. Which festival uses colors? (Holi)
7. What do we wear on our head for safety while biking? (Helmet)
8. What do you call a baby horse? (Foal)
9. How many continents are there? (Seven)
10. Which season is the coldest? (Winter)
11. Which fruit keeps the doctor away? (Apple)
12. What is frozen water called? (Ice)
13. Which vehicle runs on rails? (Train)
14. What keeps our feet warm in winter? (Socks)
15. Which shape has four equal sides? (Square)

Life Skill Options: Doing what needs to be done without being told
How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Make a simple checklist for him.
2. Let him tick tasks without reminders.
3. Celebrate completion.
Daily Rituals (summary):
Morning: “I will finish what I start.”
After school: Game + discuss task done.
Evening: Story on discipline.
Park Time Options (10\u201314+):
Kicking practice to a goal line (10 kicks)
Tree pose (yoga) for 10 slow breaths
Stone stack: build a 3‑stone tower
Make a circle with chalk and do 5 jumps inside

Throw-and-catch 10 times (soft ball)

Roll a ball to each other 15 times

Jump over 5 small lines/tiles safely
Cloud shapes: spot and describe 3 shapes

5. How many continents are there? (Seven)

7. Which shape has four equal sides? (Square)
8. What is the color of the sky on a clear day? (Blue)
9. What do bees live in? (A hive)

12. What does a clock tell us? (Time)

How to Teach / Impart (notes):
1. Choose one toy/book to give away.
2. Explain why sharing matters.
3. Make it celebratory, not forced.

Morning: “I am happy to share.”
After school: Share snack or toy.
Evening: Story on generosity.
Bonding Activity Options: Visit a place where you can donate together.

Count 10 trees or benches together
